Articles.Content:
Have a prob.

An Okto, with a com 16 on to, a small inline reaction wheel, and 2 solar panels opposite each other, a fule tank (the smallest) and an 48-76 engine. IT also has two goo tanks attached for a contract, opposite each other so should be balanced.

I can't control it. The SAS dose nothing, the reaction wheels are powered on as is the OKTO module.

I lost one of these probes because the panels were badly placed, so I turn the electric charge off while this difted out to Mun, then turned them on again on mun approach. There is charge, the panels are facing the sun, all is good, but sas wont work like it did around kerbin...

Any ideas?

Edited January 18, 2015 by MoridinUK
answered

Is the probe on the dark side and out of charge? Did you place any batteries on it?

I know it's a stupid question but then again...

Moridin: please supply a screenshot. And: are you playing with any mods? Does the probe not respond to anything you do, or does it just not obey SAS so it keeps rolling?

Edited January 19, 2015 by Vanamonde

If he placed a big reaction wheel and no batteries, the tiny amount of charge held by the core and the solar panels (which I believe are ox-stats, so fixed) would deplete as soon as he tries to turn the ship with SAS on, especially if the panels are mounted on the side and the probe is facing the nose or tail to the sun.

Edited January 18, 2015 by Janos1986

The probe had two panels faceing forwards and back, only goes out of power when in a low anything orbit. I had the small inline reaction wheel on it. Thanks for the attempts to help, reloading fixed the issue. The ship did respond to commands, but would not sas. All fix with a reload though! Thanks for helping
Some of the OKTOs have the ability to auto stabilize using a steerable engine. However, they cannot take advantage of an external SAS to do the same. Some other types can.

I run into a common bug like this, where, after returning to control a probe after going to the KSP or another ship, I can't turn it despite there being power and a reaction wheel.

Reloading can fix it, as can swapping control to another ship and back.

Its annoyingly common too...
